creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: Wine Jar (Hu), decorated with molded relief band containing running and contending animals and two Ta\'o-Ti\'eh masks with fastening rings; reddish clay, brownish glaze
medium: Stoneware with molded decor under a brown glaze
text: Late Chou potters borrowed freely from ritual bronze vessel shapes. This is understandable because through most of the Shang (1523-1028 b.c.) and Chou (1027-256 b.c.) dynasties, ceremonial bronzes constituted the highest art form. The <I>t'ao-tieh<I> mask handles, molded animal designs and shape of this earthenware <I>hu<I> relate closely to a bronze <I>hu<I> in the Pillsbury collection.
title: Hu (Ritual Wine Jar)
